explanation: The report is not supported by the evidence. Rule 8.13 requires a pointer to be to a const-qualified type when it is safe/possible to do so, i.e. when the pointed-to object is never modified by the implementation. The snippet for MHD_get_response_headers does not reference data_iov at all, and the provided struct shows data_iov declared as MHD_iovec_ * but gives no information whether the implementation ever modifies the iovec elements (e.g. adjusting iov_base/iov_len as bytes are sent) or whether API compatibility requires a non-const type. If the implementation does modify the iovec contents, the non-const declaration is correct and no 8.13 violation exists. If the implementation never modifies the iovec elements, then changing the field to const MHD_iovec_ * would satisfy 8.13. Given only the shown code, there is insufficient evidence that data_iov is immutable, so the agent’s claim of a MISRA 8.13 violation is not justified. To resolve for sure, inspect all uses of response->data_iov to see whether MHD writes to the pointed objects; if not, make it const, otherwise keep as-is.
